labels.shortDescription: Description of the Affiliation Mappings setting
labels.value: Map Account record types to the Primary Affiliation fields on Contacts to define how updates to those fields impact Affiliation records and how updates to Affiliation records impact Contact records.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Affiliations Related to Deleted Program Enrollments setting
labels.value: If an Affiliation is related to only one Program Enrollment and that Program Enrollment is deleted, also delete the Affiliation. If you don't enable this setting, select a Status for Affiliations Not Deleted.

labels.shortDescription: Course Connection and Attendance Event mismatch error message
labels.value: Specify a Course Connection that has the same Contact as you specified for this Attendance Event.

labels.shortDescription: Error when invalid autocreate relationship configured
labels.value: There's an invalid autocreate relationship setting configured in EDA Settings | Relationships | Autocreation. Delete or edit the invalid setting, then try again.

labels.shortDescription: Message when an Apex job can't run
labels.value: We couldn't run the Apex job.

labels.shortDescription: Error message for TDTM filtering functionality
labels.value: Set the Filter field, or both the Filter field and Filter value.

labels.shortDescription: Cannot Change Contact and Course Offering
labels.value: Can't change the Contact or Course Offering on a Course Connection that has associated Term Grades or Attendance Events. If you want a Course Connection with a different Contact or Course Offering, create a new Course Connection.

labels.shortDescription: Error when deleting a record with child records
labels.value: This record can't be deleted because it has one or more related records associated with it. Delete the associated records first, then delete this record. To determine which records should be deleted first, click the Related tab. If you don't see related records, or if you're unable to delete them, contact your System Administrator.

labels.shortDescription: Default text appended to Contact's last name for Acct Name (not HH or Admin)
Default Administrative Account Name
Default Household Name
EDA Settings
Education Cloud Settings
Column heading for Reciprocal Relationships
Error message for TDTM filtering functionality
labels.value: The field entered as the Filter Field isn't valid. Filter Fields can be any standard or custom field on the object this trigger is for, as well as fields on related records. Make sure you use the field's API name, and omit any EDA namespace prefix ("hed__").

labels.shortDescription: Column heading for Reciprocal Relationships settings
Error when multiple Course Connections exist
labels.value: More than one Course Connection is associated with this Contact and this Course Offering. Specify the Course Connection that represents the student's enrollment in this Course Offering for this Term Grade.

labels.shortDescription: Error when Contact and Course Offering don't match
labels.value: The Contact and Course Offering are not specified or don't match the Course Connection. Either specify only a Course Connection or both a Contact and a Course Offering, so we can save this record with the correct data.

labels.shortDescription: Error when no Course Connection found
labels.value: There is no Course Connection associated with this Contact and Course Offering. If this student is enrolled in this Course Offering, create a Course Connection.

labels.shortDescription: Error when Contact and Course Offering don't match
labels.value: The Contact and Course Offering don't match the Course Connection. Either specify only a Course Connection or both a Contact and a Course Offering, so we can save this record with the correct data.

labels.shortDescription: Error when required fields aren't populated
labels.value: Either specify only a Course Connection or both a Contact and a Course Offering.

labels.shortDescription: Provides a blank value option to custom built picklists
Error when invalid Course Connection selected
labels.value: There is no Contact or Course Offering associated with this Course Connection. Choose a valid Course Connection.

labels.shortDescription: Error when an invalid value is selected in Preferred Email
labels.value: We can't find the email specified in Preferred Email. Make sure that you're entering the field label of an existing custom email field.

labels.shortDescription: Error when the value of the email field selected in Preferred Email is null
labels.value: The email field you selected in Preferred Email is blank. Either choose a different Preferred Email, or add a value for that email field.

labels.shortDescription: Error when Preferred Email is blank
labels.value: Select a value for Preferred Email.

labels.shortDescription: Error when Preferred Phone value doesn't exist
labels.value: We can't find the Phone specified in Preferred Phone. Make sure that you're entering the field label of an existing custom Phone field.

labels.shortDescription: Error when value for phone field in Preferred Phone is blank.
labels.value: The phone selected for Preferred Phone can't be blank.

labels.shortDescription: Error when Preferred Phone is blank.
labels.value: Select a value for Preferred Phone.

labels.shortDescription: The verb in the Relationship Explanation sentence
Word separator when the Reciprocal Method setting is set to "Value Inversion"
Descrption of the Relationships Auto-Create setting
labels.value: Auto-Create settings let you define when a Relationship record is automatically created between a Contact and a Campaign Member, based on a custom lookup field on one of the two objects. For example, a 'Referral' lookup from Campaign Member to Contact could create a 'Referrer' and 'Referee' Relationship between the two Contacts. (Note that this feature is not available for Leads or Campaign Member objects that reference Leads.)

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Reciprocal Relationships setting
labels.value: Configure matching relationships so you can understand how a Contact is related to another from either Contact record.

labels.shortDescription: Picklist value for naming format used for Administrative and Household Accounts
Exception error for an invalid external call
labels.value: Invalid call. This function is reserved for Salesforce use.

labels.shortDescription: Error - DEPRECATED
labels.value: Address records can only be associated with Accounts or Contacts.

labels.shortDescription: Error when Addr record tied to Account RT without Multi-Addresses enabled
labels.value: The ability to add multiple addresses is disabled for this Account record type. To enable it, go to EDA Settings, click on Accounts and Contacts, and select the appropriate checkbox next to Account Types with Multi-Addresses Enabled.

labels.shortDescription: Error when Addr record tied to Contact and Contact Multi-Addresses disabled
labels.value: The ability to add multiple addresses is disabled for Contacts. To enable it, go to EDA Settings, click on Accounts and Contacts, then select the Contact Multi-Addresses Enabled checkbox.

labels.shortDescription: Error when multiple seasonal Addr records have overlapping dates
labels.value: There's an existing Address record for this Account or Contact with seasonal start and end dates that overlap the seasonal dates for this record. Adjust the seasonal dates so that they don't overlap with the other Address record.

labels.shortDescription: Error when some but not all start and end date fields have values
labels.value: An address can't have partial Seasonal Start and End Dates. Either enter values for all of the Seasonal Start and End date fields, or leave all of them blank.

labels.shortDescription: Error when some but not all start and end date fields have values
labels.value: An address can't have partial Seasonal Start and End Dates. Either enter values for all of the Seasonal Start and End date fields, or leave all of them blank.

labels.shortDescription: Error when Addr record has a parent object other than Account or Contact
labels.value: Address records can only be associated with Accounts or Contacts.

labels.shortDescription: Field label for the Administrative Account Name Format setting
Description of the Administrative Account Name Format setting
labels.value: The format for naming Administrative Accounts when they are automatically created.

labels.shortDescription: affiliationWithSameAccExists
labels.value: This Contact already has a Primary Affiliation to the specified Account. Either deselect the Primary setting for the other Affiliation so you can designate this one as Primary, or create this Affiliation without the Primary value.

labels.shortDescription: Error when Affiliation created for Acct with no record type
labels.value: We can't create this Affiliation because the specified Account doesn't have a record type.

labels.shortDescription: Error when Affiliation created and record type issue in Affiliation Mappings
labels.value: We can't save this record because of an Account record type error in Affiliation Mappings. Ask your administrator to verify that Account Record Types are correctly mapped to Contact Primary Affiliations.

labels.shortDescription: Error when Affiliation created and Acct RT doesn't exist
labels.value: The {0} Account record type doesn''t exist. Ask your admin to check record types in Affiliation Mappings.

labels.shortDescription: Label for the Record Type Validation setting
Description of the Record Type Validation setting
labels.value: Require Accounts specified as a Contact’s Primary Affiliation use a record type. Also ensure that all Account record types are mapped to Primary Affiliation fields on the Contact object. If validation fails, the Affiliation isn’t saved.

labels.shortDescription: Field label for the Automatically Rename Household Accounts setting
Description of the Automatically Rename Household Accounts setting
labels.value: Automatically rename Household Accounts when Contacts are added or changed.

labels.shortDescription: Error when the default Administrative Account record type can’t be found
labels.value: We can’t find the Administrative Account record type in your org. Following installation, use Object Manager to create a new record type named ‘Administrative’ for the Account object.

labels.shortDescription: Default connector word for Acct naming
Error message for TDTM filtering functionality.
Error message for TDTM filtering functionality.
labels.value: The Filter Field value names a duplicate of a product field. Specify a non-duplicate field. Otherwise, we filter using the value in the product field. If you choose the latter option, acknowledge that you accept this filtering logic by appending {0} after the field name. For example, if the duplicate field is Deceased__c, enter Deceased__c{0} as the Filter Field value.

labels.shortDescription: Error when missing required field value
labels.value: A blank required field is preventing this record from being saved. The required field could be on this record, or on a record related by a lookup value.

labels.shortDescription: Error when validation rule prevents processing
labels.value: A validation rule is preventing this record from being processed. The validation rule might be on this record, or on a related record that's being updated. VALIDATION MESSAGE:

labels.shortDescription: TDTM filter err msg
labels.value: The Filter Field can't include namespace prefixes such as hed__. Remove the namespace prefix and try again.

labels.shortDescription: Picklist value for the naming format used for Administrative Accounts
Picklist value for the naming format used for Household Accounts
Picklist value for the naming format used for Household Accounts
Error when Gift Processing config is invalid
labels.value: You are trying to access Gift Processing without the required configuration information. Contact your administrator for help.

labels.shortDescription: Field label for the Household Account Name setting
Description of the Household Account Name Format setting
labels.value: The format for naming Household Accounts when they are automatically created.

labels.shortDescription: Picklist value for the Household Account Name format
Error when a Contact's Primary Affiliation field isn't an Account lookup field
labels.value: We can't save this record because of an error with the Contact field {1}. Ask your admin to check Affiliation Mappings in EDA Settings and set the value for {0} to the API name of an Account lookup field on the Contact object instead of {1}

labels.shortDescription: Error when an Affiliation Mapping's Account record type isn't valid
labels.value: We can't save this record because {1} isn't a valid Account record type. Ask your admin to check Affiliation Mappings in EDA Settings and set the value for {0} to the API name of a valid Account record type instead of {1}.

labels.shortDescription: Picklist value for the naming format used for Administrative Accounts
Picklist value for the naming format used for Household Accounts
Picklist value for the naming format used for Administrative Accounts
Picklist value for the naming format used for Household Accounts
Picklist value for the naming format used for Household Accounts
Picklist value for the naming format used for Household Accounts
Error when Plan Requirement has both parent Plan Requirement and Program Plan
labels.value: Plan Requirements can specify either a Program Plan or a parent Plan Requirement, but not both. If this Plan Requirement is a child of another Plan Requirement, specify a parent Plan Requirement only. If this Plan Requirement is a child of a Program Plan, specify a Program Plan only.

labels.shortDescription: noAccRecType - DEPRECATED
labels.value: The defined account record type does not exist:

labels.shortDescription: Empty state message for Affiliation Mappings
labels.value: No Affiliation mappings yet. Click New to create one.

labels.shortDescription: Empty state message for Auto-Create Settings
labels.value: No Auto-Create Settings have been defined. Use the form below to create a new Auto-Create Setting.

labels.shortDescription: Empty state message for Reciprocal Settings
labels.value: No Reciprocal Settings have been defined. Use the form below to create a new Reciprocal Setting.

labels.value: If you delete this Affiliation mapping, when an Affiliation with the {0} Account record type is created for a Contact, a Program Enrollment record is no longer automatically created.

labels.shortDescription: Error when record type is already used in existing Affl Mapping
labels.value: We can't map this Affiliation because it references a record type that is already referenced by another Affiliation Mapping. If you want to add this mapping so the Affiliation is translated, click Edit to modify the existing mapping. Then, specify the field API name under Contact Primary Affl Field. Do not change the name specified for Account Record Type.

labels.value: Select values that create a Program Enrollment record when an Affiliation is created or updated with these values, and the Affiliation is marked as Primary.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the EDA app
labels.value: Education Data Architecture (EDA) is the foundation of the Education Cloud. Its flexible data architecture is designed to configure Salesforce for education.

labels.shortDescription: Initials for the EDA App
Title for the EDA App
Description of EDA Settings has moved
labels.value: We created a new Education Cloud Settings experience that provides access to EDA Settings, along with many other great resources. Setup steps vary based on your EDA version. Review the documentation for details.

labels.shortDescription: Title of EDA Settings has moved
EDA Setup title
Description of Settings Health Check
labels.value: Settings Health Check looks for configuration errors in EDA Settings and Setup. Follow the provided recommendations to fix reported errors.

labels.shortDescription: Label for the Course Connection Record Types setting
Description of the Debug Logging setting
labels.value: Enable debugging so that Salesforce support can view debug statements for managed packages.

labels.shortDescription: Label for the Debug Logging setting
Label for the Enhanced Preferred Phone Functionality setting
Message when a Due Date precedes an Open Date
labels.value: We can't save the Application because the Due Date must be after the Open Date.

labels.shortDescription: Error when the user doesn't have the permissions to view a page
labels.value: You can't view this page. Your Salesforce admin can help with that.

labels.shortDescription: Error when the user doesn't have the permissions to save settings
labels.value: You can't save these settings because you no longer have permission to edit them. Your Salesforce admin can help with that.

labels.shortDescription: Error when a generic error occurs
labels.value: We couldn’t save your work. Please refresh the page and try again.

labels.shortDescription: Message when no record types for auto-enrollment mappings exist
labels.value: All Account record types that have primary Affiliations already have an auto-enrollment mapping. Go to EDA Settings | Affiliations to first create an Affiliation mapping with the record type you want.

labels.shortDescription: Edit mode field label for System Settings
Label for the Error Notification Recipients setting
Navigation title for Errors
Section title for Error Settings
Label for the Legacy Ethnicity Data setting
Description of the Update the Race field on Contacts confirmation window
labels.value: Copies standard and custom picklist values, except Not Hispanic or Latino and Hispanic or Latino, from the Ethnicity field to the Race field on Contacts. Before proceeding, make sure you've disabled any processes that reference Ethnicity and Race fields.

labels.shortDescription: Title for the Update the Race field on Contacts confirmation window
labels.value: Update the Race field on Contacts?

labels.shortDescription: Confirmation message when the Race field is queued for update
labels.value: We're updating the Race field on Contacts. Look for an email when the job is done.

labels.shortDescription: Picklist value for Accounts and Contacts Settings
Recommended fix when the Administrative Account Record Type is inactive
labels.value: In EDA Settings | Account Model, verify the Administrative Account Record Type. If {0} ({1}) is correct, go to Salesforce Setup and set the record type to Active. If it isn't correct, change the Administrative Account Record Type to a valid, active record type.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when Health Check can't find Administrative Account Record Type
labels.value: In EDA Settings | Account Model, change the Administrative Account Record Type to a valid, active record type.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when the Default Account Model record type is inactive
labels.value: In EDA Settings | Account Model, verify the Default Account Model record type. If {0} ({1}) is correct, go to Salesforce Setup and set the record type to Active. If it isn't correct, change the Default Account Model to a valid, active record type.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when Health Check can't find Default Account Model record type
labels.value: In EDA Settings | Account Model, change the Default Account Model to a valid, active record type.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when the Household Account Record Type is inactive
labels.value: In EDA Settings | Account Model, verify the Household Account Record Type. If {0} ({1}) is correct, go to Salesforce Setup and set the record type to Active. If it isn't correct, change the Household Account Record Type to a valid, active record type.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when Health Check can't find the Household Account Record Type
labels.value: In EDA Settings | Account Model, change the Household Account Record Type to a valid, active record type.

labels.shortDescription: A check for unique container Account record type settings
labels.value: Unique Administrative and Household Account Record Type Settings.

labels.shortDescription: Description when Administrative and Household Account Record Types aren't unique
labels.value: The Administrative Account and Household Account Record Type settings specify the same record type.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when Administrative and Household Account Record Types match
labels.value: In EDA Settings | Account Model, change the Administrative Account Record Type or the Household Account Record Type so that they specify a unique record type.

labels.shortDescription: Description when Administrative and Household Account Record Types are unique
labels.value: The Administrative Account and Household Account Record Type settings specify different record types.

labels.shortDescription: Description for an Affiliation mapping in Settings Health Check results
Row heading for an Affiliation mapping in Settings Health Check results
Recommended fix when the Affiliation mapping's Account record type is inactive
labels.value: In EDA Settings | Affiliations, verify the Account Record Type for this Affiliation mapping. If {0} ({1}) is correct, go to the Account Record Type for the Account object in Salesforce Setup and set the record type to Active. If it isn't correct, change the Affiliation mapping's record type to a valid, active record type.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when the Affiliation mapping's Account record type doesn't exist
labels.value: The Account Record Type for this Affiliation mapping doesn't exist. In EDA Settings | Affiliations, change the Affiliation mapping to use a valid, active record type for the specified Account.

labels.shortDescription: Description when Account record types in Affiliation mappings are not unique
labels.value: The {0} ({1}) record type is mapped to multiple Contact Primary Affiliation fields.

labels.shortDescription: A check for Account record type in Affiliation mapping settings
Description when Account record types in Affiliation mappings are unique
labels.value: The {0} ({1}) record type is mapped to a single Contact Primary Affiliation field.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when Account record types in Affiliation mappings aren't unique
labels.value: In EDA Settings | Affiliations, look in the Account Record Type column for multiple mappings specifying {0} ({1}). Edit those Affiliation mappings so that this record type is mapped to only one Contact Primary Affiliation field.

labels.shortDescription: A check for unique Account record types in Affiliation mappings
Description when a mapping's Auto-Enrollment Role isn't active
Recommended fix when a mapping's Auto-Enrollment Role isn't active
labels.value: The Auto-Enrollment Role {0} ({1}) isn't active. In EDA Settings | Program Enrollments, verify the Auto-Enrollment Program Mapping that specifies this Role. If the mapping is correct, go to the Affiliation object's Role field in Salesforce Setup and set the picklist value to Active. If it isn't correct, change the Auto-Enrollment Role to a valid, active picklist value.

labels.shortDescription: Description when Health Check can't find a mapping's Auto-Enrollment Role
labels.value: We can’t find the {0} picklist value.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when Health Check can't find a mapping's Auto-Enrollment Role
labels.value: The Auto-Enrollment Role isn't valid. In EDA Settings | Program Enrollments, edit the Auto-Enrollment Program Mapping that specifies this Role to a valid, active picklist value for the Role field on the Affiliation object.

labels.shortDescription: A check for Auto-Enrollment Role in Affiliation mappings
Description when a mapping's Auto-Enrollment Role is valid
Description when a mapping's Auto-Enrollment Status isn't active
Recommended fix when a mapping's Auto-Enrollment Status isn't active
labels.value: The Auto-Enrollment Status {0} ({1}) isn't active. In EDA Settings | Program Enrollments, verify the Auto-Enrollment Program Mapping that specifies this Status. If the mapping is correct, go to the Affiliation object's Status field in Salesforce Setup and set the picklist value to Active. If it isn't correct, change the Auto-Enrollment Status to a valid, active picklist value.

labels.shortDescription: Description when Health Check can't find a mapping's Auto-Enrollment Status
labels.value: We can’t find the {0} picklist value.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when Health Check can't find a mapping's Auto-Enrollment Status
labels.value: The Auto-Enrollment Status isn't valid. In EDA Settings | Program Enrollments, edit the Auto-Enrollment Program Mapping that specifies this Status to a valid, active picklist value for the Status field on the Affiliation object.

labels.shortDescription: A check for Auto-Enrollment Status in Affiliation mappings
Description when a mapping's Auto-Enrollment Status is valid
Recommended fix when a mapping's Primary Affiliation field isn't valid
labels.value: The Primary Affiliation field {0} isn't valid. In EDA Settings | Affiliations, edit the Affiliation mapping to specify a valid lookup field on the Contact object.

labels.shortDescription: A check for unique Contact Primary Affiliation fields in Affiliation mappings
Description when a mapping's Contact Primary Affiliation field isn't valid
Description when mappings' Contact Primary Affiliation fields aren't unique
labels.value: The {0} ({1}) field is mapped to multiple Account record types.

labels.shortDescription: A check for Contact Primary Affiliation field in Affiliation mapping settings
Description when mappings' Contact Primary Affiliation fields are unique
labels.value: The {0} ({1}) field is mapped to a single Account record type.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when mappings' Primary Affiliation fields aren't unique
labels.value: In EDA Settings | Affiliations, look in the Primary Affiliation Field on Contact column for multiple mappings specifying {0} ({1}). Edit those mappings so that this field is mapped in only one Affiliation mapping.

labels.shortDescription: Description when a mapping's Contact Primary Affiliation field is valid
Description when Health Check finds Course Connections not enabled
Recommended fix when Course Connections isn't enabled
labels.value: Enable Course Connections, which includes configuring Course Connection record types. In EDA Settings | Course Connections, turn on Course Connection Record Types. Then configure Default Student Record Type and Default Faculty Record Type.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when the Default Faculty Record Type is inactive
labels.value: In EDA Settings | Course Connections, verify the the Default Faculty Record Type. If {1} ({0}) is correct, go to Salesforce Setup and set the record type to Active. If it isn't correct, change the Default Faculty Record Type to a valid, active record type.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when Health Check can't find Default Faculty Record Type
labels.value: In EDA Settings | Course Connections, change the Default Faculty Record Type to a valid, active record type.

labels.shortDescription: Description when student and faculty Course Connection record types not unique
labels.value: The Default Faculty Record Type and the Default Active Student Record Type settings specify the same record type.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when student and faculty Course Connection record types match
labels.value: In EDA Settings | Course Connections, change either the Default Faculty Record Type or the Default Student Record Type so that each specifies a unique record type.

labels.shortDescription: A check for unique Course Connection record type settings
labels.value: Unique Default Faculty Record Type and Default Active Student Record Type Settings

labels.shortDescription: Description when student and faculty Course Connection record types are unique
labels.value: The Default Faculty Record Type and Default Active Student Record Type settings specify different record types.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when the Default Student Record Type is inactive
labels.value: In EDA Settings | Course Connections, verify the Default Student Record Type. If {1} ({0}) is correct, go to Salesforce Setup and set the record type to Active. If it isn't correct, change the Default Student Record Type to a valid, active record type.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when Health Check can't find Default Student Record Type
labels.value: In EDA Settings | Course Connections, change the Default Student Record Type to a valid, active record type.

labels.shortDescription: Course Connections group title in Settings Health Check results
Description when Health Check finds an inactive picklist value
Description when Health Check can't find the picklist value
labels.value: We can’t find the {0} picklist value.

labels.shortDescription: Description when Health Check finds a picklist value valid
Description for a reciprocal setting in Settings Health Check results
Recommended fix when the reciprocal setting's Female value is inactive
labels.value: The picklist value for Female in the Reciprocal Relationships mapping for {0} ({1}) isn't active. In EDA Settings | Relationships, verify the mapping. If the mapping is correct, go to the Relationship object's Type field in Salesforce Setup and set the picklist value to Active. If it isn't correct, change the reciprocal setting's Female value to a valid, active picklist value.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when the reciprocal setting's Female value doesn't exist
labels.value: The picklist value for Female in the Reciprocal Relationships mapping isn't valid. In EDA Settings | Relationships, edit the Female value for this mapping to a valid, active picklist value.

labels.shortDescription: A check for the Female value in a reciprocal setting
Recommended fix when the reciprocal setting's Male value is inactive
labels.value: The picklist value for Male in the Reciprocal Relationships mapping for {0} ({1}) isn't active. In EDA Settings | Relationships, verify the mapping. If the mapping is correct, go to the Relationship object's Type field in Salesforce Setup and set the picklist value to Active. If it isn't correct, change the reciprocal setting's Male value to a valid, active picklist value.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when the reciprocal setting's Male value doesn't exist
labels.value: The picklist value for Male in the Reciprocal Relationships mapping isn't valid. In EDA Settings | Relationships, edit the Male value for this mapping to a valid, active picklist value.

labels.shortDescription: A check for the Male value in a reciprocal setting
Recommended fix when the reciprocal setting's Name value is inactive
labels.value: The Reciprocal Relationships mapping for {0} ({1}) isn't active. In EDA Settings | Relationships, verify the mapping that specifies this Name. If the mapping is correct, go to the Relationship object's Type field in Salesforce Setup and set the picklist value to Active. If it isn't correct, change the reciprocal setting's Name value to a valid, active picklist value.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when the reciprocal setting's Name value doesn't exist
labels.value: The Reciprocal Relationships mapping for {0} isn't valid. In EDA Settings | Relationships, edit the mapping that specifies this Name to a valid, active picklist value.

labels.shortDescription: Description when Name isn't unique in reciprocal settings
labels.value: Verify the reciprocal setting for {0} ({1}) specified in EDA Settings, on the Reciprocal Settings subtab of the Relationships tab. If {0} ({1}) is correct, go to the Relationship object's Type field in Salesforce Setup and set the picklist value to Active. If it isn't correct, change the reciprocal setting's Name value to a valid, active picklist value.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when the reciprocal setting's Name value isn't unique
labels.value: In EDA Settings | Relationships, look in the Reciprocal Relationships table for multiple mappings with the Name {0} ({1}). Edit those mappings so that only one mapping uses this Name.

labels.shortDescription: A check for the Name value in a reciprocal setting
Description when Name is unique in reciprocal settings
labels.value: The {0} ({1}) picklist value is used in only one reciprocal setting.

labels.shortDescription: A check for unique Name values in reciprocal settings
Recommended fix when the reciprocal setting's Neutral value is inactive
labels.value: The picklist value for Neutral in the Reciprocal Relationships mapping for {0} ({1}) isn't active. In EDA Settings | Relationships, verify the mapping. If the mapping is correct, go to the Relationship object's Type field in Salesforce Setup and set the picklist value to Active. If it isn't correct, change the reciprocal setting's Neutral value to a valid, active picklist value.

labels.shortDescription: Recommended fix when the reciprocal setting's Neutral value doesn't exist
labels.value: The picklist value for Neutral in the Reciprocal Relationships mapping isn't valid. In EDA Settings | Relationships, edit the Neutral value for this mapping to a valid, active picklist value.

labels.shortDescription: A check for the Neutral value in a reciprocal setting
Row heading for a reciprocal setting in Settings Health Check results
Description when Health Check finds an inactive record type
Description when Health Check can't find the record type
labels.value: We can’t find the {0} record type.

labels.shortDescription: Description when Health Check finds a record type valid
Label for Custom Name Format for Household Accounts
Info text for Custom Name Format
Section title for Household Account Naming
Alt text for button that launches Settings Health Check
Account Model group title in Settings Health Check results
Affiliation Mappings group title in Settings Health Check results
Settings Health Check component description
labels.value: Settings Health Check checks your EDA Settings for invalid configurations. Use the results to identify and fix invalid settings.

labels.shortDescription: Error when Settings Health Check can't show the last run date
labels.value: We can't show the last run date because of an error

labels.shortDescription: Text when a check passes and no fix is recommended
Settings Health Check last run date

Reciprocal Relationships group title in Settings Health Check results

Description column header in Settings Health Check results
Alt text for the icon to expand Settings Health Check results
EDA Settings Run Health Check button label
Error when Settings Health Check can't be run
labels.value: We can't run Settings Health Check because of an error. Try running it again.

labels.shortDescription: Setting column header in Settings Health Check results
Status column header in Settings Health Check results
Status text in Settings Health Check results when a check failed
Status text in Settings Health Check results when a check passed
Status text in Settings Health Check results when a check prompts a warning
Label for the Settings Health Check card
Text in Settings Health Check results when all checks within a group passed
Text in Settings Health Check results shows group's passed and total checks
Description of the Default Account Model setting
labels.value: The Account record type used when an Account is automatically created for an independent Contact.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Accounts Without Contacts setting
labels.value: Delete Accounts with these record types if they have no Contacts.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Enable Multiple Addresses for Account Types setting
labels.value: Select the Account record types that support multiple addresses.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Administrative Account Record Type setting
labels.value: The Account record type used for Administrative Accounts.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Affiliation End Date setting
labels.value: Copy the End Date from Program Enrollment records to new Affiliation records. Otherwise, leave the field blank.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Affiliation Start Date setting
labels.value: Copy the Start Date from Program Enrollment records to new Affiliation records. Otherwise, leave the field blank.

labels.shortDescription: Section header for Affiliations Settings
Info text for Affiliations Settings
labels.value: When a Program Enrollment record is created without an existing Affiliation, create an Affiliation record with the values specified below.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Status for Affiliations Not Deleted setting
labels.value: The Status set on the Affiliation related to a deleted Program Enrollment.

labels.shortDescription: Section header for Affiliations Settings
Info text for how Program Enrollment delete affects Affiliation
labels.value: Specify below how you want Affiliation records for deleted Program Enrollments to be handled. The related Affiliation record can either be deleted, or have its Status updated.

labels.shortDescription: Info text for enable set role on Affiliations
labels.value: If selected, set the new Affiliation's role to the value defined in Role for Created Affiliations. Otherwise, leave the Affiliation's role blank.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Role for Created Affiliations setting
labels.value: Select a role for Affiliations created with Program Enrollments.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Status for Created Affiliations setting
labels.value: Select a status for Affiliations created with Program Enrollments.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Allow Multiple Contact Addresses setting
labels.value: Allow Contacts to have multiple Address records.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Require Preferred Email setting
labels.value: Require Contacts to have a Preferred Email.

labels.shortDescription: Description for the Require Preferred Phone setting
labels.value: Require Contacts to have a Preferred Phone.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Enhanced Preferred Phone Functionality setting
labels.value: Copy the Contact's Preferred Phone to their Phone field.

labels.shortDescription: Confirmation message when the Extended Description field is queued for update
labels.value: We're updating the Extended Description field. Look for an email when the job is done.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Update Course Connection record types confirmation window
labels.value: Changes Faculty Course Connection records to the Default Faculty Record Type value, and all other Course Connection records to the Default Student Record Type value.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Legacy Course Enrollment Data setting
labels.value: Before enabling Course Connections for the first time, run this Apex job to update Faculty Course Connection records to the Default Faculty Record Type value. Also updates remaining Course Connections to the Default Student Record Type value.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Extended Course Descriptions setting
labels.value: Copies text from the Description field on Course records to the Extended Description field to accommodate longer course descriptions.

labels.shortDescription: Info text for Courses Settings
labels.value: This utility copies values from the Course Description field to the Extended Description field. This process may take some time, but you can safely close this page and the process will continue in the background.

labels.shortDescription: Info text for Courses Settings
labels.value: If a Course already has a value for Extended Description, we don't overwrite it.

labels.shortDescription: Info text for Courses Settings
labels.value: After the process is complete, remember to update page layouts and other areas of the application that refer to the Description fields.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Contact Language Fluency setting
labels.value: The Fluency value set when changing or setting a Contact's Primary Language on a Contact Language record.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Default Faculty Record Type setting
labels.value: Select the record type for faculty Course Connections.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Default Student Record Type setting
labels.value: Select the record type for student Course Connections.

labels.shortDescription: Error when Enable Course Connections field isn't selected
labels.value: You must enable Course Connections before running the Course Connections Backfill.

labels.shortDescription: Error when Enable Course Connections Field isn't selected
labels.value: You must enable Course Connections before editing record types.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Course Connections setting
labels.value: Require that Course Connection records specify whether they're for faculty or students. If you turn on this setting, also set the Default Student Record Type and Default Faculty Record Type.</br></br>Before enabling this setting for the first time, run the Legacy Course Enrollment Data Apex job in System Tools.

labels.shortDescription: Info text for Accounts and Contacts Settings
labels.value: For existing Contacts who haven't specified a Preferred Email or Preferred Phone, the cleanup ensures that one of the Contact's standard or custom email addresses or phone numbers are set as the preferred value.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Error Handling setting
labels.value: Allow error handling for asynchronous jobs to make it easier to see when scheduled jobs fail.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Error Notifications setting
labels.value: Send error notifications to selected recipients. If you choose Chatter Group or User, also specify a value in Error Notification Recipients.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Error Notification Recipients setting
labels.value: Enter a single user name or Chatter group. Users are notified of errors by email, Chatter groups are notified with a post to the feed.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Legacy Ethnicity Data setting
labels.value: If you used the Ethnicity field before EDA version 1.28, this Apex job updates the Race field on Contacts with a copy of standard and custom values from the Ethnicity field. The values Not Hispanic or Latino and Hispanic or Latino aren't copied.

labels.shortDescription: stgHelpOrgAccountAddressMgmt - DEPRECATED
labels.value: Enables Address management for Administrative and Household Accounts when selected.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Household Account Record Type setting
labels.value: The Account record type used for Household Accounts.

labels.shortDescription: Info text for Accounts and Contacts Settings
labels.value: If your org previously added custom picklist values to the Ethnicity field that you want to be available in the Race field, copy those custom picklist values to the Race field.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Plan Requirement Hierarchy setting
labels.value: If you have a hierarchy for nested Plan Requirements, specifying that they can have only a Program Plan or only a parent Plan Requirement can help maintain your structure.

labels.shortDescription: stgHelpOrgAccountAddressMgmt - DEPRECATED
labels.value: Enables Address management for Organizational Accounts when selected.

labels.shortDescription: Info text for Relationships Settings
labels.value: Auto-created Relationships are deduplicated by default to prevent duplicate Relationship records from being created between two Contacts. Select "Allow Auto-Created Duplicate Relations" to disable this behavior and allow multiple Relationships of the same type between two Contacts.

labels.shortDescription: Description for the Reciprocal Method setting
labels.value: Specify how to populate the Type field on automatically created Reciprocal Relationships. Select List Setting to use the values from the Reciprocal Relationships. Select Value Inversion to invert the Type on the original Relationship record.

labels.shortDescription: Info text for Accounts and Contacts Settings
labels.value: Remove all picklist values from the Ethnicity field except for "Hispanic or Latino" and "Not Hispanic or Latino." We recommend that you replace each removed value with one of the remaining valid values, rather than deleting them outright from existing records. As of EDA version 1.28, the only valid Ethnicity values are "Not Hispanic or Latino" and "Hispanic or Latino."

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Update Address Records for Simple Changes setting
labels.value: For simple address changes to Contacts or Accounts, update existing Address records rather than creating new ones.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Store Errors setting
labels.value: Log and store errors on the Error object. After this setting is enabled, create a tab for the Error object to view error records.

labels.shortDescription: Info text for Accounts and Contacts Settings
labels.value: If you had reports or formula fields that referenced the previous values in the Ethnicity field, update them.

labels.shortDescription: Label for the Automatically Rename Lead-Converted Accounts setting
Description of the Automatically Rename Lead-Converted Accounts setting
labels.value: When Leads are converted, automatically rename Accounts to use the account naming format associated with these selected record types.

labels.shortDescription: Section title for Lead Conversion Account Naming
Label for the Plan Requirement Hierarchy setting
Title for the New Affiliation Mapping window

Picklist value for Error Notifications

Picklist value for Error Notifications
Navigation title for People and Groups
Body of email after Run Cleanup for preferred email/phone
labels.value: The Apex job processed {0} records with {1} failures.

labels.shortDescription: Subject of email after Run Cleanup for preferred email/phone
labels.value: Preferred Email/Phone Job completed with a status of:

labels.shortDescription: Label for the Preferred Email and Preferred Phone setting
Label for the Default Preferred Phone setting
Description of the Update Preferred Email and Phone fields confirmation window
labels.value: Refreshes Preferred Email and Preferred Phone fields for all Contacts as specified by your org's related settings. Before proceeding, make sure you've disabled any processes that reference Preferred Email and Preferred Phone fields.

labels.shortDescription: Title for the Update Preferred Email and Phone fields confirmation window
labels.value: Update Preferred Email and Phone fields?

labels.shortDescription: Confirmation message when Preferred Email and Phone fields are queued for update
labels.value: We're updating the Preferred Email and Preferred Phone fields. Look for an email when the job is done.

labels.shortDescription: Select a desired picklist value for the batch job to select a value from
labels.value: Select a field for Preferred Phone to copy the value from when the standard Phone field has no value, or more than one 'Phone' field is defined.

labels.shortDescription: Description for the Default Preferred Phone setting
labels.value: The field to use for Preferred Phone when the Phone field is blank, or more than one phone value is defined.

labels.shortDescription: Navigation title for Program Plans
Section title for Program Plan Settings
Navigation title for Program Enrollments
Section title for Program Enrollment Settings
Picklist value for the method used for Reciprocal Method
Picklist value for the method used for Reciprocal Method
Description of the Delete Reciprocal Relationship window
labels.value: This Reciprocal Relationship maps the {0} reciprocal value to the {1} {2}, and {3} reciprocal values. We're just making sure that you want to delete it.

labels.shortDescription: Title for the Delete Reciprocal Relationship window
Confirmation message when a Reciprocal Relationship is created
Description of the Edit Reciprocal Relationship window
labels.value: Select the Reciprocal Relationship to edit.

labels.shortDescription: Title for the Edit Reciprocal Relationship window
Confirmation message when a Reciprocal Relationship is saved
Description of the New Reciprocal Relationship window
labels.value: Select the Reciprocal Relationship type to create.

labels.shortDescription: Title for the New Reciprocal Relationship window
Confirmation message when a Reciprocal Relationship is created
Description of the Update All Administrative Account Names setting
labels.value: Updates all Administrative Account records to use the format in Administrative Account Name Format.</br></br>Warning: Before proceeding, learn about the impact of this setting. Also disable processes that reference Administrative Accounts.

labels.shortDescription: Label for the Update All Administrative Account Names setting
Description of the Update all Administrative Account names confirmation window
labels.value: Refreshes all Administrative Account records to use the format in Administrative Account Name Format. Before proceeding, make sure you've disabled any processes that reference Administrative Accounts.

labels.shortDescription: Title for the Update All Administrative Account Names confirmation window
Confirmation message when Administrative Account names are queued for update
labels.value: We're updating Administrative Account names. Look for an email when the job is done.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Update All Household Account Names setting
labels.value: Updates all Household Account records to use the format in Household Account Name Format. Also enables Automatically Rename Household Accounts, even if previously disabled. </br></br> Warning: Before proceeding, learn about the impact of this setting. Also disable processes that reference Household Accounts.

labels.shortDescription: Label for the Update All Household Account Names settings
Description of the Update all Household Account names confirmation window
labels.value: Refreshes all Household Account records to use the format in Household Account Name Format. Before proceeding, make sure you've disabled any processes that reference Household Accounts.

labels.shortDescription: Title for the Update all Household Account names confirmation window
Confirmation message when Household Account names are queued for update
labels.value: We're updating Household Account names. Look for an email when the job is done.

labels.shortDescription: Navigation title for Relationships
Section title for Relationship Settings
Label for the Release Management card
Description of Release Management
labels.value: Release Management makes it easy to learn about the features in the current release and then activate the release when you're ready.

labels.shortDescription: Release Management page title
Button label for updating the selected Apex job
Alt text for button that updates Contacts' Preferred Email/Phone fields
labels.value: Update Preferred Email and Phone fields for all Contacts.

labels.shortDescription: Description of the Preferred Email and Preferred Phone setting
labels.value: Updates Preferred Email and Preferred Phone for all Contacts based on your org's related settings. It's a good idea to run this job when you enable Require Preferred Email or Require Preferred Phone for the first time or if you haven't enforced them for a while.

labels.shortDescription: Confirmation messsage that updated settings were saved

Error when End Time and Time Block are mismatched
labels.value: We can't save the Course Offering Schedule because its End Time doesn't match the End Time of its associated Time Block. Either edit the End Time, specify a different Time Block, or don't specify a Time Block.

labels.shortDescription: Error when Start Time and Time Block are mismatched
labels.value: We can't save the Course Offering Schedule because its Start Time doesn't match the Start Time of its associated Time Block. Either edit the Start Time, specify a different Time Block, or don't specify a Time Block.
